<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 324, 293]]<|/det|>
## FURTHER MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
9231/22  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 368, 317]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Further Pure Mathematics 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 301, 905, 317]]<|/det|>
May/June 2023  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 326, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 371]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 393, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 485, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 361, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 868, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 480, 575]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 606]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 860, 637]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 220, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 384, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 728, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 426, 89]]<|/det|>
Show that the system of equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 97, 566, 116]]<|/det|>
\[x + 2y + 3z = 1,\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 117, 566, 136]]<|/det|>
\[4x + 5y + 6z = 1,\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 138, 566, 157]]<|/det|>
\[7x + 8y + 9z = 1,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 179, 410, 197]]<|/det|>
does not have a unique solution.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 180, 920, 197]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 459, 143, 477]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 459, 920, 477]]<|/det|>
Show that the system of equations in part (a) is consistent. Interpret this situation geometrically.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 475, 920, 494]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 97, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 715, 91]]<|/det|>
Use the substitution \(z = x + y\) to find the solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[450, 97, 586, 129]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = \frac{1 + 3x + 3y}{3x + 3y - 1}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 152, 920, 186]]<|/det|>
for which \(y = 0\) when \(x = 1\). Give your answer in the form \(a\ln (x + y) + b(x - y) + c = 0\), where \(a\), \(b\) and \(c\) are constants to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 166, 920, 185]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 97, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 144, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 74, 920, 112]]<|/det|>
By considering the binomial expansion of \((z + z^{-1})^{4}\), where \(z = \cos \theta + \mathrm{i}\sin \theta\), use de Moivre's theorem to show that \(\cos^{4}\theta = \frac{1}{8} (\cos 4\theta + 4\cos 2\theta + 3)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 92, 920, 111]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 495, 186, 514]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 485, 715, 515]]<|/det|>
Use the substitution \(x = \sin \theta\) to find the exact value of \(\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2}}(1 - x^{2})^{\frac{3}{2}}\mathrm{d}x.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 496, 920, 515]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 81, 94, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 507, 109]]<|/det|>
The integral \(I_{n}\) is defined by \(I_{n} = \int_{0}^{1}(1 + x^{5})^{n}\mathrm{d}x.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 125, 144, 144]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 123, 589, 149]]<|/det|>
By considering \(\frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}x} \big(x(1 + x^5)^n\big)\), or otherwise, show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 173, 638, 195]]<|/det|>
\[(5n + 1)I_n = 2^n + 5nI_{n - 1}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 175, 920, 193]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 316, 89]]<|/det|>
The matrix \(\mathbf{A}\) is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 83, 599, 139]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{A} = \left( \begin{array}{ccc}18 & 5 & -11\\ 8 & 6 & -4\\ 32 & 10 & -20 \end{array} \right).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 163, 146, 182]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 163, 918, 198]]<|/det|>
Show that the characteristic equation of \(\mathbf{A}\) is \(\lambda^3 - 4\lambda^2 - 20\lambda + 48 = 0\) and hence find the eigenvalues of \(\mathbf{A}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 180, 920, 198]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 660, 92]]<|/det|>
Find a matrix \(\mathbf{P}\) and a diagonal matrix \(\mathbf{D}\) such that \(\mathbf{A}^5 = \mathbf{P}\mathbf{D}\mathbf{P}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 94, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 71, 544, 90]]<|/det|>
Find the particular solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[403, 94, 633, 127]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}x}{\mathrm{d}t^{2}} -12\frac{\mathrm{d}x}{\mathrm{d}t} +36x = 37\sin t,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 144, 398, 170]]<|/det|>
given that, when \(t = 0\), \(x = \frac{\mathrm{d}x}{\mathrm{d}t} = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 149, 920, 168]]<|/det|>
<mark>[11]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 96, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 71, 792, 91]]<|/det|>
Starting from the definitions of sech and tanh in terms of exponentials, prove that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[457, 100, 616, 120]]<|/det|>
\[1 - \mathrm{sech}^{2}t = \tanh^{2}t. \quad [3]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 101, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 381, 416, 400]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has parametric equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[304, 409, 771, 432]]<|/det|>
\[x = \textstyle {\frac{1}{2}}\tanh^{2}t + \ln \mathrm{sech}t,\qquad y = 1 + \tanh^{4}t,\qquad \mathrm{for} t > 0.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 457, 146, 476]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 451, 369, 477]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = -4 \mathrm{sech}^2 t.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 458, 920, 477]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 84, 144, 103]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 77, 918, 126]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of the point on \(C\) with \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}y}{\mathrm{dx}^{2}} = -\frac{9}{2}\), giving your answer in the form \((a + \ln b, c)\) where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are rational numbers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 106, 918, 125]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 73, 567, 90]]<|/det|>
# Additional page  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 102, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
If you use the following page to complete the answer to any question, the question number must be clearly shown.
